headline.main: NEWS BY TELEGRAPH.; The Mexican Treaty Returned to Mr. McLane--Probable Success of the Negotiations--Condition of Gen. Davis--Indian Affairs in California, &c. PROM WASHINGTON.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. McLANE'S private secretary left here yesterday for Pensacola, from which port he sails in the steamer Brooklyn for Vera Cruz. He takes back Mr. McLANE's project for a treaty, with the partial approbation only of Mr. BUCHUNAN, but with the confident belief on the part of the Washington Cabinet that the negotiation will be favorably concluded.

docs.snippet: Paymaster A. J. Coffee, United States Army, has tendered his resignation, which has been accepted, to take effect from July 31, 1859. Isaac Winston, of Kansas Territory, has been appointed Paymaster, vice Coffee, resigned. The following items are...
docs.lead_paragraph: Paymaster A. J. Coffee, United States Army, has tendered his resignation, which has been accepted, to take effect from July 31, 1859. Isaac Winston, of Kansas Territory, has been appointed Paymaster, vice Coffee, resigned. The following items are from the Fort Smith Times of July 28: Col. Constantine Perkins arrived here on Tuesday.

docs.snippet: The proposal made by Mr. GLADSTONE, not only to retain, but raise the income tax in England to ninepence in the pound, bids fair to revive the somewhat acrimonious discussion by which all England was agitated on the same subject a few years ago;
docs.lead_paragraph: The proposal made by Mr. GLADSTONE, not only to retain, but raise the income tax in England to ninepence in the pound, bids fair to revive the somewhat acrimonious discussion by which all England was agitated on the same subject a few years ago;

docs.snippet: THE GOLD DISCOVERIES OF CHIRIQUI--A VESSEL BOUND TO THE DIGGINGS.--The announcement of extensive gold discoveries, in the shape of idols and relics, among the Indian mounds of Chiriqui, has attracted considerable attention, and the excitement has...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE GOLD DISCOVERIES OF CHIRIQUI--A VESSEL BOUND TO THE DIGGINGS.--The announcement of extensive gold discoveries, in the shape of idols and relics, among the Indian mounds of Chiriqui, has attracted considerable attention, and the excitement has been gradually on the increase since the arrival of the last steamer from California.

headline.main: THE LATE DR. ALEXANDER.; Funeral of the Rev. Dr. Alexander at Princeton--Address of the Rev. Dr. Hodge.

docs.lead_paragraph: The usual monotony of this quiet town was suddenly broken yesterday morning by the telegraphic announcement of the death in Virginia, of one who has been ordered to the inhabitants of this vicinity curing a long life spent among them. The sad intelligence was soon spread through the town and gloom cast o'er the countenances of those with whom Dr. ALEXANDER was long associated while residing among them.

headline.main: AFFAIRS AT WASHINGTON.; Mr. Buchanan's Movements--The Organ's Distress at the Disclosures Published in the New-York Times--Speculations at the Capital.

docs.lead_paragraph: We find the following paragraph in the Washington Correspondence of the Philadelphia North America : "The President's visit to Bedford has been shortened a few days, from the urgency of the Mexican and other questions, for it should be known that he not only supervises but actually directs the diplomacy of the Administration.

docs.lead_paragraph: BOARD OF SUPERVISORS.--ANNUAL MEETING.-The able meeting of the Kings County Board of Supervisors was held yesterday afternoon, in the old Court-room, County Jail building.
